message.content:
We need to determine how much the interest receivables “changed” over the period. In our transactions each record that has type “Interest Receivables” represents an increase in the interest receivable asset (in most cases, interest has accrued but not received, so the “debit” or increase adds to the asset). For the cash‐flow statement the “Increase in Interest Receivable” is a use of cash; therefore it is shown as a negative adjustment. (That is why in our sample the final answer was “–2672.87”.)

To solve the current problem we scan through every transaction whose “type” is “Interest Receivables”. (We note that the “amount” field on these rows is in a common unit.) Then we add all those amounts to see what the ending balance (i.e. the net addition) is and then report it with a negative sign.

Below is a summary (we list the amount from each “Interest Receivables” row):

1. Interest20240101001: 445.0  
2. Interest20240102002: 445.0  
3. Interest20240103003: 445.0  
4. Interest20240104004: 444.911  
5. Interest20240105005: 444.911  
6. Interest20240106006: 444.911  
7. Interest20240107007: 444.822  
8. Interest20240108008: 442.152  
9. Interest20240109009: 442.152  
10. Interest20240110010: 442.152  
11. Interest20240111011: 442.152  
12. Interest20240112012: 442.152  
13. Interest20240113013: 424.085  
14. Interest20240114014: 424.085  
15. Interest20240115015: 424.085  
16. Interest20240116016: 422.305  (rounding 422.30499999999995 to 422.305)  
17. Interest20240117017: 421.415  (rounding 421.41499999999996 to 421.415)  
18. Interest20240118018: 419.635  
19. Interest20240119019: 419.635  
20. Interest20240120020: 419.635  
21. Interest20240121021: 419.635  
22. Interest20240122022: 419.635  
23. Interest20240123023: 419.635  
24. Interest20240124024: 419.635  
25. Interest20240125025: 419.635  
26. Interest20240126026: 419.635  
27. Interest20240127027: 419.635  
28. Interest20240128028: 419.635  
29. Interest20240129029: 419.635  
30. Interest20240130030: 419.635  
31. Interest20240131031: 419.635  
32. Interest20240201032: 419.635  
33. Interest20240202033: 419.635  
34. Interest20240203034: 419.546  
35. Interest20240204035: 419.546  
36. Interest20240205036: 419.546  

Now we add these step‐by‐step:

• 445.0 + 445.0 + 445.0  = 1335.0  
• Adding three amounts of 444.911 → 444.911×3 = 1334.733, so 1335.0 + 1334.733 = 2669.733  
• Then add 444.822 : 2669.733 + 444.822 = 3114.555  
• Add two entries of 442.152 (3114.555 + 442.152 + 442.152) = 3998.859  
• Add another 442.152 : 3998.859 + 442.152 = 4441.011  
• Another 442.152 → 4441.011 + 442.152 = 4883.163  
• Another 442.152 → 4883.163 + 442.152 = 5325.315  
• Add 424.085 : 5325.315 + 424.085 = 5749.4  
• Then add 424.085 to get 6173.485  
• Another 424.085 gives 6597.57  
• Add 422.305 : 6597.57 + 422.305 = 7019.875  
• Then add 421.415 : 7019.875 + 421.415 = 7441.29  
• Now several 419.635’s follow. There are 10 occurrences from the next steps:  
  7441.29 + 419.635 = 7860.925  
  7860.925 + 419.635 = 8280.56  
  8280.56 + 419.635 = 8700.195  
  8700.195 + 419.635 = 9119.83  
  9119.83 + 419.635 = 9539.465  
  9539.465 + 419.635 = 9959.1  
  9959.1 + 419.635 = 10378.735  
  10378.735 + 419.635 = 10798.37  
  10798.37 + 419.635 = 11218.005  
  11218.005 + 419.635 = 11637.64  
• Then add another 419.635 nine more times:  
  11637.64 + 419.635 = 12057.275  
  12057.275 + 419.635 = 12476.91  
  12476.91 + 419.635 = 12896.545  
  12896.545 + 419.635 = 13316.18  
  13316.18 + 419.635 = 13735.815  
  13735.815 + 419.635 = 14155.45  
• Next add 419.546 : 14155.45 + 419.546 = 14574.996  
• Add another 419.546 : 14574.996 + 419.546 = 14994.542  
• Finally add the last 419.546 : 14994.542 + 419.546 = 15414.088  

Thus the total “increase” in interest receivable is about 15,414.09.

Since an increase in an asset (interest receivable) is shown as a decrease (use of cash) in the indirect method of the cash flow statement, we report it as –15,414.09.

Thus the final answer is:

{
  "solution": {
    "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-15414.09"
  }
}
